files.patch:
@@ -533,4 +533,6 @@
-  // known optimization could be applied to those users. Certain
-  // optimizations have dependencies that extend beyond a node's direct
-  // inputs, so it is necessary to ensure the appropriate notifications
-  // are made here.
+  // known optimization could be applied to those users.
+  // Node 'n' is a node that was modified or is about to get replaced,
+  // and 'use' is one use of 'n'.
+  // Certain optimizations have dependencies that extend beyond a node's
+  // direct inputs, so it is necessary to ensure the appropriate
+  // notifications are made here.
@@ -541,5 +543,5 @@
-  // This function may be called with a node that is about to be
-  // replaced as argument 'n'. In this case, 'n' should not be considered
-  // part of the new graph. Passing the old node (as 'n'), rather than
-  // the new node, prevents unnecessary notifications when the new node
-  // already has other users.
+  // Node 'n' may be a node that is about to get replaced. In this
+  // case, 'n' should not be considered part of the new graph.
+  // Passing the old node (as 'n'), rather than the new node,
+  // prevents unnecessary notifications when the new node already
+  // has other users.
